clinical_study.brief_title: TRF-1101 Assessment in Sickle Cell Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Assess the Safety and Activity of TRF-1101 on Microvascular Blood Flow, Vascular Endothelial Injury, and Vasoocclusive Pain in Patients With Sickle Cell Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to assess the safety, tolerability, and activity of TRF-1101 on microvascular blood flow, vascular endothelial injury, and vasoocclusive pain associated with sickle cell disease.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study was stopped due to perceived futility because the baseline pain score in first 40 patients was too low to be able demonstrate an improvement

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.measure: Microvascular blood flow and trends in frequency of vasoocclusive pain

intervention.description: once daily treatment with 300 mg orally for 12 weeks
Daily treatment with TRF-1101 vehicle for 12 weeks
